newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asia Product Swap-Gas oil dips as buyers sidelined.
newsitem.headline: Asia Product Swap-Gas oil dips as buyers sidelined.

text.p: Singapore gas oil swaps slipped from morning levels on Monday as initial expectations that physical buyers would prop up demand started to wane, traders and brokers said.
August gas oil swaps were last offered at $22.95 with a bid heard notionally at $22.75. August indications were lower from morning quotes at $23.00/$23.20.
September was last quoted at $23.20/$23.40, down 20 cents from morning indications.
Brokers said there was a lack of buying interest in the swaps market while more offers were seen.
Sentiment in the physical market now appeared less euphoric than it was last week when a number of traders purchased a total of 1.1 million barrels in the first four days.
But physical gas oil prices started to soften on Friday, losing about 10 cents as buyers moved to the sidelines while a major made aggressive offers.
Some traders said Friday's dip might be the start of a downtrend.
They cited poor demand from China and high stocks both on the mainland and Singapore and an overhang seen in the prompt market.
Singapore middle distillate stocks for the week ending July 23 rose by 469,000 barrels to 11.084 million, the Trade Development Board said on Thursday.t.

But a few bulls remained. A handful of traders cited support from a healthy crude market and the recent spate of strong buying interests by traders who were primarily covering their short-positions into Indonesia.
Traders also noted that current levels could be sustained as Asia enters the fourth quarter, when buyers traditionally start to buy to stock up for the upcoming winter.
